item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, October 23, 2024 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Everything I built with Claude Artifacts this week (174 points | 113 comments)
2. Playstation Vita Architecture (Part 1) (103 points | 35 comments)
3. Show HN: Wall-mounted diffusion mirror that turns reflections into paintings (13 points | 1 comment)
4. What happens when you make a move in lichess.org? (151 points | 74 comments)
5. Show HN: Open-source low-code email editor (58 points | 6 comments)
6. Post-postal: What did we lose when we stopped writing letters? (24 points | 22 comments)
7. Fearless SSH: Short-lived certificates bring Zero Trust to infrastructure (32 points | 19 comments)
8. iOS 18.2 Lets EU Users Delete App Store, Safari, Messages, Camera and Photos (30 points | 25 comments)
9. Probably pay attention to tokenizers (149 points | 46 comments)
10. My NumPy year: Creating a DType for the next generation of scientific computing (16 points | 2 comments)
11. A DSL for peephole transformation rules of integer operations in the PyPy JIT (69 points | 6 comments)
12. GitButler now supports first class conflicts, making rebasing less annoying (58 points | 33 comments)
13. Show HN: A macOS Client for HuggingFace Chat (82 points | 14 comments)
14. Launch HN: GPT Driver (YC S21) – End-to-end app testing in natural language (87 points | 70 comments)
15. Parks on the Air (65 points | 24 comments)
16. Bulk optimization of queries in Postgres (39 points | 3 comments)
17. Async Rust in Three Parts (67 points | 12 comments)
18. Show HN: I built a task manager that separates "do" and "due" dates (93 points | 38 comments)
19. Taming the buck with a Type III compensator (12 points | 2 comments)
20. Shanghai Before the Foreigners (38 points | 19 comments)
21. Goldman and Apple 'illegally sidestepped' obligations to credit-card customers (191 points | 100 comments)
22. Seeing faces in things: A model and dataset for pareidolia (32 points | 5 comments)
23. Reinforcement Learning: An Introduction (2018) (45 points | 13 comments)
24. Show HN: Srcbook – Self-hosted alternative to AI app builders (34 points | 1 comment)
25. Show HN: Agent.exe, a cross-platform app to let 3.5 Sonnet control your machine (305 points | 175 comments)
26. DawVert – a DAW project file converter (33 points | 13 comments)
27. The Tragedy of Google Books (2017) (373 points | 156 comments)
28. The Incredible Machine (1968) [video] (60 points | 30 comments)
29. The Script Creator (15 points | 1 comment)
30. My NumPy year: Creating a DType for the next generation of scientific computing (70 points | 9 comments)
